head.title: Bonds Are Priced By Florida County

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Bonds Are Priced By Florida County

block.p: Orange County, Fla., tentatively priced a tax-exempt hospital revenue bond issue yesterday with a maximum yield of 6.809 percent for a debt security due in 2005 through an underwriting group led by Ziegler Securities.

The financing is on behalf of Adventist Health System Sun Belt Inc. and includes bonds with yields ranging from 5.25 percent in 1992 to 6 percent in 1996 to 6.60 percent in 2002. Underwriters said the issue had been rated Baa-1 by Moody's and AAA by S.& P., whose rating is based on insurance coverage by the Capital Guaranty Insurance Company.
